definition[0]: using or involving a lot of effort, people, supplies etc
definition[1]: a large-scale map, model etc is drawn or made bigger than usual, so that more details can be shown
definition[2]: using or involving a lot of people, effort, money, or supplies
example[1]: The government hopes to attract large-scale foreign investment.
example[2]: Large-scale changes to the organizational structure of the company are needed.
example[3]: Large-scale oil production did not begin in Saudi Arabia until after World War II.
